title: Bob seeing former President Truman out the door
Scopenote: At the 10th Street Barbershop, Bob, an employee, is seeing former President Truman out the door.

title: Harry S. Truman Getting a Haircut
Scopenote: In the 10th Street barbershop, former President Harry S. Truman is getting a haircut from Frank Spina, while Robert Brown ("Bob") is shining Mr. Truman's shoes. Donor: Edward Meisburger (a friend from Battery D, as is Frank Spina)

title: Portrait of George C. McGhee
Scopenote: George C. McGhee, Director, U.S. Commercial Co., 1946; Special Assistant to Under Secretary for Economic Affairs, U.S. Department of State, 1946-47; Coordinator for Aid to Greece and Turkey, 1947; Special Assistant to Under Secretary of State, 1947-49; Special Assistant to Secretary of State, March-June 1949; Assistant Secretary for Near Eastern South Asian-African Affairs, 1949-51; and U.S. Ambassador and Chief of American Mission for Aid to Turkey, 1951-53. Also served as Senior Adviser, North Atlantic Treaty Council, Ottawa, Canada, 1951.

title: Harry Truman, thirteen years old
Scopenote: Portrait of Harry S. Truman at age 13, wearing a bow tie and glasses.  See also 62-97, 62-412, 66-2929, 77-61, and 79-26.
Institutional Creator: W.A. Hare and Co., Independence, MO

title: Young Harry S. Truman with family on a farm wagon at Grandview, Missouri
Scopenote: On a farm wagon at the Truman farm in Grandview, Missouri - left to right:  Mary Jane Truman, sister of Harry S. Truman; Harry S. Truman; Martha Young Truman, mother of Harry S. Truman; Myra Colgan, cousin of Harry S. Truman; J. Vivian Truman, brother of Harry S. Truman; and Nellie Tilford Noland, cousin of Harry S. Truman.  Donated by Mary Ethel Noland

title: House Party at Truman Farm
Scopenote: House Party at the Truman farm home, Christmas 1911. Front row: Robert Truman Ragland; Mary Ethel Noland; Second row: Luella Campbell Truman; Homer Pittinger; Nellie Noland; Mary Colgan; Callie Campbell; Back row: Mary Jane Truman. Man standing next to window is unidentified. Martha Ellen Truman can be seen inside the house, looking out the window.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman in the uniform of the Missouri National Guard, standing
Scopenote: Lovely original portrait of Harry S. Truman in the uniform of the Missouri National Guard, standing.

title: Harry S. Truman in World War I Uniform
Scopenote: Postcard studio portrait photo of Harry S. Truman wearing his uniform and helmet, taken in France during World War I. Noted on the reverse of the postcard "Given to John A. Hatfield in France in 1918 - returned to Harry S. Truman in January, 1962." Donor: John A. Hatfield.

title: Benjamin Hardy and Christine Hardy Little
Scopenote: Benjamin Hardy (right) and Christine Hardy Little.  Mr. Hardy was Chief Public Affairs Officer, Technical Cooperation Administration, Department of State, 1950-1951.  Photograph used in conjunction with oral history interview of Mrs. Hardy Little.

title: Tom Pendergast trial
Scopenote: Tom Pendergast, Sr. (center) during his trial for tax evasion with son, Tom Pendergast, Jr. (left), and nephew, James Pendergast (right).  The three men are seated at the defense counsel's table after the judge has passed the sentence.

title: Informal portrait of Senator Truman
Scopenote: 1940 Senate Campaign photo. Senator Harry S. Truman posed with open book.

title: Senator Harry Truman and Bess Truman Working in Their Apartment
Scopenote: In one of a series of photographs depicting a typical day in the life of Senator Harry S. Truman, Senator Truman and his wife, Bess, work on correspondence in his apartment at 4701 Connecticut in Washington, D. C.  From:  New York Herald Tribune.

title: Photo of Fred Truman
Scopenote: Fred L. Truman, son of Vivian Truman and nephew of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Senator Truman in San Francisco
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman on PC in San Francisco Bay, California.

title: Senator Harry S. Truman in San Francisco, California
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and other members of the Truman Committee are on board a patrol craft to see the San Francisco Bay area in San Francisco, California. From left to right: Senator Homer Ferguson (back to camera); Senator Truman, three unidentified men, and Senator Harley Kilgore.

title: Senator and Mrs. Truman making breakfast
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman (left) and his wife, Bess Wallace Truman (right) making breakfast.

title: Senator Truman and Others Inspecting Camp Crowder
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman and others inspecting Camp Crowder, Missouri. Front Row, left to right: Albert Strong, Colonel Ernest Barker, Colonel George Teachout, Brigadier General Calvert Arnold, Major General Walter E. Prosser, Senator Truman, Brigadier Generals Charles Milliken, Barney L. Allis, and Frank H. Duggins, Lieutenant Colonel Harry Wright. Middle row, left to right: Colonel Walter F. Hamilton, Colonel Robert A. Willard, Colonel Sol P. Fink, Major Thomas D. Mitchell, Matthew Connelly, and Lieutenant Colonel Francis Rickley. Back row, left to right: Captain Mark M. Marks, Majors Henry Gann, Paul Van Pool, George Spiva, Harry Ensley, and Lieutenant Colonel Bain.

title: Senator Truman at Camp Crowder, Missouri
Scopenote: Senator Harry S. Truman inspects items at Camp Crowder, Missouri as Major General Walter E. Prosser looks on. Donor: Walter E. Prosser.

title: Portrait of Harry S. Truman
Scopenote: Formal color head-and-shoulders portrait of President Harry S. Truman, wearing a blue tie with diamonds and squares, his Masonic pin, and a plain white pocket square. See 97-2011 for a black and white version.

title: Truman being sworn in as Vice-President
Scopenote: Harry S. Truman being sworn in as Vice President of the United States at the White House.  From left to right: Edwin Halsey, Secretary of the Senate; Henry A. Wallace; Senator Arthur Vandenberg of Michigan; unidentified Secret Service man; Colonel James Roosevelt, United States Marine Corps; Vice President Harry S. Truman (taking oath); and Major General Edwin M. Watson, Secretary to the President.

title: President Franklin D. Roosevelt's Fourth Inauguration
Scopenote: President Franklin D. Roosevelt holds up his right hand as he takes the oath of office during his fourth Inauguration at the White House. Supreme Court Justice Harlan Stone administers the oath at far left, Vice President Harry S. Truman smiles at left, and Roosevelt's son, Colonel James Roosevelt, stands in uniform at right.

title: Lana Turner with Vice-President Truman
Scopenote: From left to right: Carter T. Barron, representative of Loew's Capitol Theater, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Pictures; Vice President Harry S. Truman; Lana Turner; Admiral William Halsey; and Senator Alben Barkley at the U.S. Capitol.  Donor: Carter T. Barron.

title: Independence, Missouri Town Square
Scopenote: The town square of Independence, Missouri, showing the Jackson County courthouse and street scene.   Donor: Philadelphia Inquirer.

title: Truman driving through Washington State
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (behind the wheel), halts automobile before a panoramic view of Mount Rainier during his visit to Mount Rainier National Park.  In the car with President Truman are his host, Governor Mon Wallgren and Colonel Harry H. Vaughan, the President's military aide.

title: Portrait of Kenneth Royall
Scopenote: Portrait of Kenneth C. Royall, the Secretary of War, 1947, and Secretary of the Army, 1947-1949.

title: Truman conversing with James Pendergast
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) with James Pendergast, evidently taken in Independence, Missouri, upon Truman's arrival from Washington, D.C.  This photo has been badly retouched and contains crop marks.  Donor: John Boos

title: President Harry S. Truman Meets with State Department Officials Before London Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meets with State Department officials in the Oval Office, Washington, DC. Original caption reads: "Present report on forthcoming London conference. President Truman today received a 'progress report' from top State Department officials on preparations for United States participation in the Foreign Ministers Conference at London. Photo shows, left to right: President Truman; Undersecretary of State Robert Lovett; George F. Kennan, Director of the State Department's Policy Planning staff; and Charles E. Bohlen, Special Assistant to the Secretary of State."

title: President Truman and his Cabinet, 1948
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with his Cabinet seated around a table in the Cabinet Room, 1948.  From left to right: Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug; Secretary of Commerce W. Averell Harriman; Federal Works Administrator Philip B. Fleming; Assistant to the President John R. Steelman; Secretary of Labor Lewis B. Schwellenbach; Secretary of Agriculture Clinton P. Anderson; Postmaster General Jesse M. Donaldson; Secretary of Defense James V. Forrestal; Secretary of State George C. Marshall, President Truman; Secretary of the Treasury John W. Snyder; and Attorney General Tom C. Clark. Same as photo 59-1478.

title: Bob Hope presents a Red Cross pin to President Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) receives Red Cross pin from entertainer Bob Hope (right) to "kick off" 1948 American Red Cross campaign, with ex-ambassador to Japan Joseph C. Grew (center) looking on.

title: Presidential Plane at Boca Chica
Scopenote: The Presidential airplane, the "Sacred Cow" arrives at Boca Chica Naval Airfield, Florida, at the start of a vacation to Florida, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Cuba.

title: Naval Officers Salute Truman
Scopenote: Senior officers at the Naval Base in Key West, Florida, salute President Truman upon his arrival. From left to right: Captain Cecil C. Adell, Captain O. A. Smith, Captain Henry M. Cooper, Captain J. R. Ruhsenberger, Captain M. E. A. Gouin, Captain A. G. W. McFadden, Captain L. R. Daspit, and Captain W. A. Saunders.

title: Truman Leaves Boca Chica Airfield
Scopenote: Admiral William D. Leahy (left, back to camera), President Harry S. Truman (center), and Captain Cecil Adell (right, in uniform) get into a car and prepare to leave Boca Chica Airfield for the President's Quarters at the naval base in Key West, Florida. Truman is beginning a vacation trip to Key West, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Cuba. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Arrives in Florida
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman exits his plane upon arrival at Boca Chica Naval Airfield in Florida. He is starting on a vacation trip to Florida, Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, and Cuba.

title: Truman Inspects Honor Guard in San Juan
Scopenote: At the naval air station in San Juan, Puerto Rico, President Harry S. Truman (third from left), Governor Jesus Pinero (left) and Admiral Daniel Barbey (center) inspect the Guard of Honor.

title: Truman and Others at Airfield in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (at podium) speaking upon his arrival at the Naval Air Station in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Standing behind Truman, from left to right: Colonel Robert B. Landry, Air Force Aide to the President; Honorable Julius A. Krug, Secretary of the Interior; Honorable Jesus T. Pinero, Governor of Puerto Rico; Honorable Luis Munoz Marin, President of Puerto Rican Senate; Dr. Francisco Susoni, Speaker of the House of Puerto Rico (slightly behind Marin, wearing hat and two-tone shoes); Vice Admiral Daniel E. Barbey; Major General Harry H. Vaughan, Army Aide to the President (slightly behind Barbey); Captain Robert L. Dennison, Naval Aide to the President. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Speaking in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving from the speaker's platform at the Naval Air Station in San Juan during ceremonies welcoming him to Puerto Rico.

title: Governor Pinero Congratulates Truman at the Conclusion of His Address
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right, just behind podium) receiving congratulations from Governor Jesus Pinero of Puerto Rico following his address at the Naval Air Station in San Juan, during ceremonies welcoming the President to Puerto Rico. Standing on the left, from left to right are Colonel Robert Landry, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, and President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin (smoking cigarette). Standing between Governor Pinero and President Truman is Vice Admiral Daniel Barbey. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Getting Into His Automobile in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (standing in car) getting into his automobile after lunch at a hotel near Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico, for the return to San Juan. The other man seated in the car is Jesus Pinero, the Governor of Puerto Rico. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Visit to Fort Brooke, San Juan, Puerto Rico
Scopenote: After leaving Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico, President Harry S. Truman (backseat, passenger side) visits Fort Brooke, San Juan. He is greeted by Lieutenant General Willis D. Crittenberger (standing, left) and Major General Ray E. Porter (standing, second from left). Also in the back seat of the car with President Truman are Admiral William D. Leahy (center) and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Greeting Spectators During San Juan Trip
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, left) waving to the crowd of spectators after his address, during his trip to San Juan, Puerto Rico. Governor Jesus T. Pinero (second from right) and Secretary of the Interior Julius A. Krug (right) also pictured. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman With Governor Pinero
Scopenote: Governor Jesus T. Pinero of Puerto Rico (foreground, second from right) greets President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from right) upon his arrival in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Also present is Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (foreground, right). They are standing underneath the wing of President Truman's plane, the "Sacred Cow." All others are unidentified.

title: Truman at Naval Air Station, San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) at the Naval Airfield at San Juan, Puerto Rico, with Governor Jesus T. Pinero (left) and Vice Admiral Daniel Barbey (center).

title: Truman Salutes the Color Guard in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (third from left), Governor Jesus Pinero (left) and Admiral Daniel Barbey (center) salute the color guard at the naval air station during his vacation stop in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

title: Truman at the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with the Governor of Puerto Rico and others on the terrace of the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug and President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin.

title: Truman and Others at Jagueyes Hotel in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with the Governor of Puerto Rico and others on the terrace of the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug and President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin. The man with his back to the camera is unidentified.

title: Crowd Gathered in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: A crowd of people gathered at the Naval Air Station, San Juan, Puerto Rico, to witness the arrival of President Harry S. Truman.

title: Truman Greeted by Dignitaries in Puerto Rico
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman greeted by dignitaries upon is arrival at the Naval Air Statin in San Juan, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Dr. Francisco Susoni, Speaker of the House of Puerto Rico; Mr. Luis Munoz Marin, President of the Senate of Puerto Rico; President Truman; Jesus T. Pinero, Governor of Puerto Rico; Secretary of the Interior of Julius Krug.

title: Truman Departing For Tour of San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, passenger side) and Puerto Rican Governor Jesus Pinero (back seat, driver's side) in a car at the naval air station, departing for a sightseeing tour of San Juan. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Walking Across Airfield in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walking across the airfield after arrival in San Juan, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Secretary Julius A. Krug, Colonel Robert B. Landry (back to camera), Governor Jesus T. Pinero, Admiral Daniel E. Barbey, General Harry H. Vaughan (mostly obscured by Truman), President Truman, Captain Robert L. Dennison, and Mr. James Rowley.

title: Truman Leaving Aguas Buenas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with the Governor of Puerto Rico, Jesus T. Pinero (right). They are in an automobile, leaving a hotel in Aguas Buenas to return to San Juan.

title: Truman With Munoz Marin and Pinero
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) is greeted by Luis Munoz Marin, President of the Puerto Rican Senate (left) and Jesus T. Pinero, the Governor of Puerto Rico (right). They are at the Naval Air Station Airport, standing underneath the wing of President Truman's plane, the "Sacred Cow." All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Departing For Tour of San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, passenger side) and Puerto Rican Governor Jesus Pinero (back seat, driver's side) in a car at the naval air station, departing for a sightseeing tour of San Juan. Others are unidentified.

title: Truman Leaving Airport in San Juan
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaving the airport in San Juan, Puerto Rico during his vacation trip there. From left to right: Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: Truman With Others on the Terrace at Jagueyes Hotel
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman meeting with the Governor of Puerto Rico and others on the terrace of the Jagueyes Hotel in Aguas Buenas, Puerto Rico. From left to right: Admiral William Leahy, President of the Puerto Rican Senate Luis Munoz Marin, Governor Jesus T. Pinero, President Truman, and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug.

title: Truman Attending Welcoming Ceremony in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center) admiring a message of welcome from the Municipal Council of St. Thomas and St. John at Emancipation Park at Charlotte Amalie, Virgin Islands. Governor William Hastie is speaking at the microphone and Mr. Roy Gordon, Chair of the Municipal Council, stands to the President's left. They are standing beneath a banner which says "Welcome President Truman, Champion of Human Rights." Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman With Governor William Hastie at Magens Bay, St. Thomas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, driver's side) and Governor William Hastie (back seat, passenger side) in their automobile at "Drake's Seat," a promontory overlooking Magens Bay, on the island of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Departing the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman walking off the gangplank of the U.S.S. Williamsburg at Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. President Truman visited the Virgin Islands as part of a vacation cruise. Sailors in the background are unidentified.

title: Truman Inspecting Honor Guard, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left, in white suit) inspecting an honor guard composed of St. Thomas Home Guardsmen upon his arrival at Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. President Truman visited the Virgin Islands as part of a vacation cruise.

title: Truman and Governor William Hastie Posing For Photographers
Scopenote: President Truman (center, left) and Governor William Hastie (center, right) of the Virgin Islands posing for photographers at "Drake's Seat," a promontory overlooking Magens Bay, on the island of St. Thomas. Also present is Major Harry Vaughan, Truman's military aide (second from right) and Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug (far right). Others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Harbor in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: Harbor at Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, as seen from Bluebeard Hill, on the occasion of President Harry S. Truman's visit to the Virgin Islands.

title: Truman Greeting Reception Committee at Charlotte Amalie
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, second from left) shaking hands with members of the reception committee welcoming him to Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, as Governor William Hastie (left) looks on. All others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Governor Hastie Greets Truman
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) is greeted by Governor William Hastie (second from left) as he leaves his yacht, the U.S.S. Williamsburg, for a tour of the island of St. Thomas, Virgin Islands. Standing in the background are, from left to right: William Hassett (wearing bow tie), Captain Robert Dennison, General Wallace Graham (mostly obscured by Krug), Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Chair of the Municipal Council of St. Thomas Mr. Roy Gordon, and Colonel Robert Landry (mostly obscured by Gordon). All others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Harbor in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: The harbor at Charlotte Amalie, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands, on the occasion of President Harry S. Truman's visit to the island.

title: Truman with Governor Hastie in St. Thomas
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) with Governor William Hastie (right) of the Virgin Islands at "Drake's Seat," a promontory overlooking Magens Bay, on the island of St. Thomas. Truman visited St. Thomas during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Receiving Gift During Virgin Islands Visit
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) receiving a hand-carved mahogany tray from Ralph Paiewonsky (center), Chairman of the St. Thomas Reception Committee, as Governor William Hastie (left) of the Virgin Islands looks on, during welcoming ceremonies for the President at Emancipation Park in Charlotte Amalie. The banner behind them reads "Welcome President Truman, Champion of Human Rights." Truman visited the Virgin Islands as part of his vacation cruise.

title: Truman Delivering a Speech at Christiansted, St. Croix
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right) delivering a speech at Christiansted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. Standing behind Truman, from left to right: Major Harry Vaughan, unidentified (mostly obscured by Vaughan), Admiral William D. Leahy, Secretary of the Interior Julius Krug, Alexander Moorhead, and three unidentified men. President Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Crowd at Harbor At Frederiksted, St. Croix
Scopenote: The large crowd gathered at the harbor at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands awaiting the arrival of President Harry S. Truman. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: U.S.S. Williamsburg Anchored Off St. Croix, Virgin Islands
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman's yacht, the U.S.S. Williamsburg, anchored off of Frederiksted Harbor, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. Truman visited the St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Leaves the Williamsburg At Frederiksted
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman leaves his yacht, the U.S.S. Williamsburg, for the municipal dock at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. All are unidentified. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Acknowledges Crowd At Fort Christian
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman waving to the crowd at Fort Christian during his visit to St. Croix, Virgin Islands. Front row, from left to right: Mr. Alexander Moorhead, Chairman Municipal Council of St. Croix; Secretary of Interior Julius Krug; President Truman; and Governor William Hastie. All others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Crew Members Aboard the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: Crew members aboard President Harry S. Truman's yacht, the U.S.S. WILLIAMSBURG, as it approached anchorage at Frederiksted, St. Croix, Virgin Islands. All are unidentified. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: U.S.S. Greenwich Bay, Off St. Croix
Scopenote: The U.S.S. Greenwich Bay, carrying representatives of the press covering President Harry S. Truman's trip to the Virgin Islands, anchored off Frederiksted Harbor, St. Croix. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Boarding the U.S.S. Williamsburg
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, in white hat) returning to his yacht, the U.S.S. Williamsburg, at Frederiksted Harbor during his visit to St. Croix, Virgin Islands. All others are unidentified. Truman visited St. Croix during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Chief Petty Officer's Club, Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: The Chief Petty Officer's Club at the United States Naval Base, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, during President Truman's visit to the base. Photographers and reporters are exiting the building after eating lunch there. All are unidentified. Truman visited the base during his vacation cruise.

title: Truman Visiting United States Naval Base, Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) in his automobile during an inspection tour of the United States Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, listening to a group of school children singing "My Country Tis of Thee." Seated in the front seat is Admiral William Leahy. All others are unidentified. Truman visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise of the area.

title: Truman Boarding a Plane, Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) boards a plane after his visit to the United States Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. He visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise of the area. He is boarding the plane in order to fly to Key West, Florida for the remainder of his vacation. He is shaking hands with White House staff member William Simmons.

title: Children Gathered to Greet President Truman
Scopenote: School children at the United States Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, during President Truman's visit to the base. President Truman visited the base during his vacation cruise.

title: Truman Inspects Base Band, Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, fourth from left) inspecting the base band during his visit to the U.S. Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. Also present is Admiral William D. Leahy (left) and Captain E. C. Battle, Commander of the Guantanamo Bay Base (third from left, behind Truman). All others are unidentified. Truman visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise in the area.

title: Truman Receiving Gift While Visiting Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman receiving a scrapbook, a gift from the pupils at the United States Naval Base school at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, from William Barrett, the twelve-year-old son of Chief Pharmacist's Mate P. W. Barrett. Truman visited the base during a vacation cruise of the area. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Arrives at Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (foreground, third from left, in civilian clothes) being greeted by Captain E. C. Battle (foreground, second from left) upon his arrival at the U.S. Naval Base, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. Truman visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman Greeted by Children at Guantanamo Bay
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (back seat, left) riding in his automobile past a group of school children during his visit to the U.S. Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. He visited Guantanamo Bay while on a vacation cruise. All others are unidentified.

title: Children Greeting President Truman
Scopenote: An unidentified child waving two U.S. flags during President Harry S. Truman's visit to the U.S. Naval Base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. Truman visited Guantanamo Bay during a vacation cruise.

title: Truman With Children at Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman poses with three young admirers while on vacation in Key West, Florida.  Left to right: Curtis Hingson, son of Lieutenant Commander and Mrs. J. M Hingson: Sandra Jean Smith and Ray Smith, Jr., children of Lieutenant Commander and Mrs. Ray Smith.

title: Truman's Arrival at U.S. Naval Base, Key West
Scopenote: Southard Street Gate at the submarine base in Key West, Florida, with sailors and Marines lined up in anticipation of President Harry S. Truman's visit.  The "rail" is manned in anticipation of the President's arrival

title: Sailors Aboard U.S.S. Requin
Scopenote: Crew members aboard the U.S.S. Requin, a submarine at the United States Naval Base in Key West, Florida, lined up for inspection during a visit by President Harry S. Truman. Truman spent part of his vacation at the naval base in Key West. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Leaving U.S.S. Requin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (right, on gangplank) receiving the salute of the crew as he leaves the U.S.S. Requin following his inspection of the submarine.  Truman visited the submarine during his vacation in Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Truman on U.S.S. Requin
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center in civilian clothes) pauses during an inspection of the U.S.S. Requin to shake hands with an unidentified enlisted crew member. Truman visited the submarine during his vacation in Key West, Florida. All others unidentified.

title: Sailors on U.S.S. Requin
Scopenote: Crew of the U.S.S. Requin, a submarine at the U.S. Naval Base in Key West, Florida, standing at attention for an inspection by President Harry S. Truman. Truman visited the base during his vacation. All are unidentified.

title: Truman Touring Submarine Base, Key West
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (center, with cane) during a tour of the submarine base at Key West, Florida, with Assistant Press Secretary Eben Ayers (left) and Captain Robert Dennison, Naval Aide to the President (right). Others are unidentified.

title: Rear View of Little White House, Key West
Scopenote: Rear view of the Little White House at Key West, Florida.

title: Captain Robert Dennison with Fish
Scopenote: Naval Aide to President Harry S. Truman, Captain Robert Dennison, poses with a 29-pound King Mackerel which he caught on a fishing expedition. With him, from left to right are: Major General Wallace Graham, Correspondence Secretary William Hassett, Admiral William Leahy (in background with hat and glasses), Eben Ayers (partly obscured), unidentified reporter, Colonel Robert Landry (mostly obscured), and Special Counsel Clark Clifford. They all joined President Harry S. Truman on his vacation at Key West, Florida. All others are unidentified.

title: Little White House Exterior
Scopenote: The "Little White House," President Harry S. Truman's vacation quarters at Key West, Florida.

title: White House Staffers at Key West
Scopenote: White House staff members during President Harry S. Truman's vacation at Key West, Florida. From left to right: Special Counsel to the President Clark Clifford; Correspondence Secretary William Hassett; Assistant to the President John Steelman; and Appointments Secretary Matthew Connelly on the lawn of the Little White House.

title: Truman Press Conference
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman holding a press conference on the lawn of the "Little White House," his vacation quarters at Key West, Florida. Press corps unidentified. Standing behind President Truman are various members of his staff, including William Hassett (third from left), Colonel Robert Landry (fourth from left), Eben Ayers (sixth from left, behind Truman), Clark Clifford (behind Truman, partly obscured), Admiral William Leahy (eighth from left), and Major General Harry Vaughan (ninth from left, wearing t-shirt). All others are unidentified.

title: Key West Highway
Scopenote: The famous Keys Highway between Boca Chica and Key West, Florida. This photo was taken during President Harry S. Truman's vacation in Key West.

title: Truman with Military Aides

title: Diagram of assassination attempt on President Truman at Blair House
Scopenote: Diagram view of Blair House, scene of the attempt on President Truman's life.  Floyd Boring, Secret Service Agent, shot and critically wounded Oscar Collazo and the latter fell at the foot of Blair House steps.  Griselio Torresola, co-conspirator, was shot and killed, falling over a hedge beside the entrance to the Lee House (adjoining Blair House).  Donald Birdzell, White House policeman, ran to the car tracks to draw the gunfire away from Blair House.  Donor:  Philadelphia Inquirer.

title: Extra security at Blair House after assassination attempt on President Truman
Scopenote: Extraordinary measures are being taken to protect President Harry S. Truman after yesterday's suicidal attempt by two Puerto Rican fanatics to shoot their way into Blair House.  The guard at the home has been doubled and additional police are patrolling the Pennsylvania Avenue block.  This view from across the street shows White House police stationed at strategic vantage points.

They have a free government and their own governor."
